definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: I highly be pleottomd concerning the preceding manwis precious precise exercise.
sentences.chinese: 我高度赏玩后面那私人难得的切确演练。

sentences.english: I highly treasure the preceding manis precious precise exercise.
sentences.chinese: 我高度赏玩后面那私人难得的正确演练。

sentences.english: Maybe Adam Guettel, but he supports drilling.
sentences.chinese: 亚当葛特或许能与之一较高低，但他支持演练。

sentences.english: They did a drill this week where they hid a bomb underwater.
sentences.chinese: 本周他们做了一次演练，他们把一枚炸弹藏在水下。

sentences.english: Practice your presentation; role-play and video tape yourself if possible.
sentences.chinese: 演练演讲，角色扮演，如果有可能的话可以录制下来。

sentences.english: Formulate pre-proposal on fire fighting and emergency evacuation and organize regular fire drill.
sentences.chinese: 制定灭火和应急疏散预案，定期组织消防演练。

sentences.english: But this is often limited to small probing manoeuvres.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这往往局限于小的探查演练。

sentences.english: Practice skillfully and there are benefits to improve the ability of the actual combat.
sentences.chinese: 习之纯熟，对于演练实战技能，颇有益处。

sentences.english: Practice your speech and revise it if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 演练你的演讲稿，并且做必要的修改。

sentences.english: Bodhidharma channel-changing Scripture is one of the earliest exercise method that were practiced by Shaolin Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 达摩易筋经是少林寺众僧演练的最早功法之一。

sentences.english: Drill twelve 1/2-inch holes through the plywood bottom of the bin for drainage.
sentences.chinese: 演练中的12英寸洞透过胶合板底部拉登进行排水。

sentences.english: Once you have the whole scene worked out, mentally rehearse it for speed.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你把整个场景都想好了，就再快速地演练几遍。

sentences.english: Fourth, carefully carry out emergency exercises to enhance the level of mine disaster prevention and resilience.
sentences.chinese: 四是认真开展应急演练活动，提升矿井防灾抗灾水平。

sentences.english: The walkthroughs should be done as a series.
sentences.chinese: 这些演练应作为一个系列来完成。

sentences.english: There is already a hole in the center of the bracket, so you only need to drill the transom .
sentences.chinese: 已经有一个洞的中心支架，所以你只需要演练的横梁。

sentences.english: Because its drilling launches an attack often by long sleeve Tibet, therefore calls "the long sleeve fist".
sentences.chinese: 因其演练出击时常以长袖藏手，故又称“长袖拳”。

definition: dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
